098/**
099 * BucketCache uses {@link BucketAllocator} to allocate/free blocks, and uses BucketCache#ramCache
100 * and BucketCache#backingMap in order to determine if a given element is in the cache. The bucket
101 * cache can use off-heap memory {@link ByteBufferIOEngine} or mmap
102 * {@link ExclusiveMemoryMmapIOEngine} or pmem {@link SharedMemoryMmapIOEngine} or local files
103 * {@link FileIOEngine} to store/read the block data.
104 * <p>
105 * Eviction is via a similar algorithm as used in
106 * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.LruBlockCache}
107 * <p>
108 * BucketCache can be used as mainly a block cache (see
109 * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.CombinedBlockCache}), combined with a BlockCache to
110 * decrease CMS GC and heap fragmentation.
111 * <p>
112 * It also can be used as a secondary cache (e.g. using a file on ssd/fusionio to store blocks) to
113 * enlarge cache space via a victim cache.
114 */
115@InterfaceAudience.Private
116public class BucketCache implements BlockCache, HeapSize {
117  private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BucketCache.class);
118
119  /** Priority buckets config */
120  static final String SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.single.factor";
121  static final String MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.multi.factor";
122  static final String MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.memory.factor";
123  static final String EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.extrafreefactor";
124  static final String ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.acceptfactor";
125  static final String MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME = "hbase.bucketcache.minfactor";
126  static final String BACKING_MAP_PERSISTENCE_CHUNK_SIZE =
127    "hbase.bucketcache.persistence.chunksize";
128
129  /** Use strong reference for offsetLock or not */
130  private static final String STRONG_REF_KEY = "hbase.bucketcache.offsetlock.usestrongref";
131  private static final boolean STRONG_REF_DEFAULT = false;
132
133  /** Priority buckets */
134  static final float DEFAULT_SINGLE_FACTOR = 0.25f;
135  static final float DEFAULT_MULTI_FACTOR = 0.50f;
136  static final float DEFAULT_MEMORY_FACTOR = 0.25f;
137  static final float DEFAULT_MIN_FACTOR = 0.85f;
138
139  private static final float DEFAULT_EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR = 0.10f;
140  private static final float DEFAULT_ACCEPT_FACTOR = 0.95f;
141
142  // Number of blocks to clear for each of the bucket size that is full
143  private static final int DEFAULT_FREE_ENTIRE_BLOCK_FACTOR = 2;
144
145  /** Statistics thread */
146  private static final int statThreadPeriod = 5 * 60;
147
148  final static int DEFAULT_WRITER_THREADS = 3;
149  final static int DEFAULT_WRITER_QUEUE_ITEMS = 64;
150
151  final static long DEFAULT_BACKING_MAP_PERSISTENCE_CHUNK_SIZE = 10000;
152
153  // Store/read block data
154  transient final IOEngine ioEngine;
155
156  // Store the block in this map before writing it to cache
157  transient final RAMCache ramCache;
158
159  // In this map, store the block's meta data like offset, length
160  transient Map<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> backingMap;
161
162  private AtomicBoolean backingMapValidated = new AtomicBoolean(false);
163
164  /**
165   * Map of hFile -> Region -> File size. This map is used to track all files completed prefetch,
166   * together with the region those belong to and the total cached size for the
167   * region.TestBlockEvictionOnRegionMovement
168   */
169  final Map<String, Pair<String, Long>> fullyCachedFiles = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
170  /**
171   * Map of region -> total size of the region prefetched on this region server. This is the total
172   * size of hFiles for this region prefetched on this region server
173   */
174  final Map<String, Long> regionCachedSize = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
175
176  private BucketCachePersister cachePersister;
177
178  /**
179   * Enum to represent the state of cache
180   */
181  protected enum CacheState {
182    // Initializing: State when the cache is being initialised from persistence.
183    INITIALIZING,
184    // Enabled: State when cache is initialised and is ready.
185    ENABLED,
186    // Disabled: State when the cache is disabled.
187    DISABLED
188  }
189
190  /**
191   * Flag if the cache is enabled or not... We shut it off if there are IO errors for some time, so
192   * that Bucket IO exceptions/errors don't bring down the HBase server.
193   */
194  private volatile CacheState cacheState;
195
196  /**
197   * A list of writer queues. We have a queue per {@link WriterThread} we have running. In other
198   * words, the work adding blocks to the BucketCache is divided up amongst the running
199   * WriterThreads. Its done by taking hash of the cache key modulo queue count. WriterThread when
200   * it runs takes whatever has been recently added and 'drains' the entries to the BucketCache. It
201   * then updates the ramCache and backingMap accordingly.
202   */
203  transient final ArrayList<BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry>> writerQueues = new ArrayList<>();
204  transient final WriterThread[] writerThreads;
205
206  /** Volatile boolean to track if free space is in process or not */
207  private volatile boolean freeInProgress = false;
208  private transient final Lock freeSpaceLock = new ReentrantLock();
209
210  private final LongAdder realCacheSize = new LongAdder();
211  private final LongAdder heapSize = new LongAdder();
212  /** Current number of cached elements */
213  private final LongAdder blockNumber = new LongAdder();
214
215  /** Cache access count (sequential ID) */
216  private final AtomicLong accessCount = new AtomicLong();
217
218  private static final int DEFAULT_CACHE_WAIT_TIME = 50;
219
220  private final BucketCacheStats cacheStats = new BucketCacheStats();
221  private final String persistencePath;
222  static AtomicBoolean isCacheInconsistent = new AtomicBoolean(false);
223  private final long cacheCapacity;
224  /** Approximate block size */
225  private final long blockSize;
226
227  /** Duration of IO errors tolerated before we disable cache, 1 min as default */
228  private final int ioErrorsTolerationDuration;
229  // 1 min
230  public static final int DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION = 60 * 1000;
231
232  // Start time of first IO error when reading or writing IO Engine, it will be
233  // reset after a successful read/write.
234  private volatile long ioErrorStartTime = -1;
235
236  private Configuration conf;
237
238  /**
239   * A ReentrantReadWriteLock to lock on a particular block identified by offset. The purpose of
240   * this is to avoid freeing the block which is being read.
241   * <p>
242   */
243  transient final IdReadWriteLock<Long> offsetLock;
244
245  NavigableSet<BlockCacheKey> blocksByHFile = new ConcurrentSkipListSet<>(
246    Comparator.comparing(BlockCacheKey::getHfileName).thenComparingLong(BlockCacheKey::getOffset));
247
248  /** Statistics thread schedule pool (for heavy debugging, could remove) */
249  private transient final ScheduledExecutorService scheduleThreadPool =
250    Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(1,
251      new ThreadFactoryBuilder().setNameFormat("BucketCacheStatsExecutor").setDaemon(true).build());
252
253  // Allocate or free space for the block
254  private transient BucketAllocator bucketAllocator;
255
256  /** Acceptable size of cache (no evictions if size < acceptable) */
257  private float acceptableFactor;
258
259  /** Minimum threshold of cache (when evicting, evict until size < min) */
260  private float minFactor;
261
262  /**
263   * Free this floating point factor of extra blocks when evicting. For example free the number of
264   * blocks requested * (1 + extraFreeFactor)
265   */
266  private float extraFreeFactor;
267
268  /** Single access bucket size */
269  private float singleFactor;
270
271  /** Multiple access bucket size */
272  private float multiFactor;
273
274  /** In-memory bucket size */
275  private float memoryFactor;
276
277  private long bucketcachePersistInterval;
278
279  private static final String FILE_VERIFY_ALGORITHM =
280    "hbase.bucketcache.persistent.file.integrity.check.algorithm";
281  private static final String DEFAULT_FILE_VERIFY_ALGORITHM = "MD5";
282
283  private static final String QUEUE_ADDITION_WAIT_TIME =
284    "hbase.bucketcache.queue.addition.waittime";
285  private static final long DEFAULT_QUEUE_ADDITION_WAIT_TIME = 0;
286  private long queueAdditionWaitTime;
287  /**
288   * Use {@link java.security.MessageDigest} class's encryption algorithms to check persistent file
289   * integrity, default algorithm is MD5
290   */
291  private String algorithm;
292
293  private long persistenceChunkSize;
294
295  /* Tracing failed Bucket Cache allocations. */
296  private long allocFailLogPrevTs; // time of previous log event for allocation failure.
297  private static final int ALLOCATION_FAIL_LOG_TIME_PERIOD = 60000; // Default 1 minute.
298
299  public BucketCache(String ioEngineName, long capacity, int blockSize, int[] bucketSizes,
300    int writerThreadNum, int writerQLen, String persistencePath) throws IOException {
301    this(ioEngineName, capacity, blockSize, bucketSizes, writerThreadNum, writerQLen,
302      persistencePath, DEFAULT_ERROR_TOLERATION_DURATION, HBaseConfiguration.create());
303  }
304
305  public BucketCache(String ioEngineName, long capacity, int blockSize, int[] bucketSizes,
306    int writerThreadNum, int writerQLen, String persistencePath, int ioErrorsTolerationDuration,
307    Configuration conf) throws IOException {
308    Preconditions.checkArgument(blockSize > 0,
309      "BucketCache capacity is set to " + blockSize + ", can not be less than 0");
310    boolean useStrongRef = conf.getBoolean(STRONG_REF_KEY, STRONG_REF_DEFAULT);
311    if (useStrongRef) {
312      this.offsetLock = new IdReadWriteLockStrongRef<>();
313    } else {
314      this.offsetLock = new IdReadWriteLockWithObjectPool<>(ReferenceType.SOFT);
315    }
316    this.conf = conf;
317    this.algorithm = conf.get(FILE_VERIFY_ALGORITHM, DEFAULT_FILE_VERIFY_ALGORITHM);
318    this.ioEngine = getIOEngineFromName(ioEngineName, capacity, persistencePath);
319    this.writerThreads = new WriterThread[writerThreadNum];
320    long blockNumCapacity = capacity / blockSize;
321    if (blockNumCapacity >= Integer.MAX_VALUE) {
322      // Enough for about 32TB of cache!
323      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cache capacity is too large, only support 32TB now");
324    }
325
326    this.acceptableFactor = conf.getFloat(ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_ACCEPT_FACTOR);
327    this.minFactor = conf.getFloat(MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_MIN_FACTOR);
328    this.extraFreeFactor = conf.getFloat(EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR);
329    this.singleFactor = conf.getFloat(SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_SINGLE_FACTOR);
330    this.multiFactor = conf.getFloat(MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_MULTI_FACTOR);
331    this.memoryFactor = conf.getFloat(MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, DEFAULT_MEMORY_FACTOR);
332    this.queueAdditionWaitTime =
333      conf.getLong(QUEUE_ADDITION_WAIT_TIME, DEFAULT_QUEUE_ADDITION_WAIT_TIME);
334    this.bucketcachePersistInterval = conf.getLong(BUCKETCACHE_PERSIST_INTERVAL_KEY, 1000);
335    this.persistenceChunkSize =
336      conf.getLong(BACKING_MAP_PERSISTENCE_CHUNK_SIZE, DEFAULT_BACKING_MAP_PERSISTENCE_CHUNK_SIZE);
337    if (this.persistenceChunkSize <= 0) {
338      persistenceChunkSize = DEFAULT_BACKING_MAP_PERSISTENCE_CHUNK_SIZE;
339    }
340
341    sanityCheckConfigs();
342
343    LOG.info("Instantiating BucketCache with acceptableFactor: " + acceptableFactor
344      + ", minFactor: " + minFactor + ", extraFreeFactor: " + extraFreeFactor + ", singleFactor: "
345      + singleFactor + ", multiFactor: " + multiFactor + ", memoryFactor: " + memoryFactor
346      + ", useStrongRef: " + useStrongRef);
347
348    this.cacheCapacity = capacity;
349    this.persistencePath = persistencePath;
350    this.blockSize = blockSize;
351    this.ioErrorsTolerationDuration = ioErrorsTolerationDuration;
352    this.cacheState = CacheState.INITIALIZING;
353
354    this.allocFailLogPrevTs = 0;
355
356    for (int i = 0; i < writerThreads.length; ++i) {
357      writerQueues.add(new ArrayBlockingQueue<>(writerQLen));
358    }
359
360    assert writerQueues.size() == writerThreads.length;
361    this.ramCache = new RAMCache();
362
363    this.backingMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>((int) blockNumCapacity);
364    instantiateWriterThreads();
365
366    if (isCachePersistent()) {
367      if (ioEngine instanceof FileIOEngine) {
368        startBucketCachePersisterThread();
369      }
370      startPersistenceRetriever(bucketSizes, capacity);
371    } else {
372      bucketAllocator = new BucketAllocator(capacity, bucketSizes);
373      this.cacheState = CacheState.ENABLED;
374      startWriterThreads();
375    }
376
377    // Run the statistics thread periodically to print the cache statistics log
378    // TODO: Add means of turning this off. Bit obnoxious running thread just to make a log
379    // every five minutes.
380    this.scheduleThreadPool.scheduleAtFixedRate(new StatisticsThread(this), statThreadPeriod,
381      statThreadPeriod, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
382    LOG.info("Started bucket cache; ioengine=" + ioEngineName + ", capacity="
383      + StringUtils.byteDesc(capacity) + ", blockSize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(blockSize)
384      + ", writerThreadNum=" + writerThreadNum + ", writerQLen=" + writerQLen + ", persistencePath="
385      + persistencePath + ", bucketAllocator=" + BucketAllocator.class.getName());
386  }
387
388  private void startPersistenceRetriever(int[] bucketSizes, long capacity) {
389    Runnable persistentCacheRetriever = () -> {
390      try {
391        retrieveFromFile(bucketSizes);
392        LOG.info("Persistent bucket cache recovery from {} is complete.", persistencePath);
393      } catch (IOException ioex) {
394        LOG.error("Can't restore from file[{}] because of ", persistencePath, ioex);
395        backingMap.clear();
396        fullyCachedFiles.clear();
397        backingMapValidated.set(true);
398        try {
399          bucketAllocator = new BucketAllocator(capacity, bucketSizes);
400        } catch (BucketAllocatorException ex) {
401          LOG.error("Exception during Bucket Allocation", ex);
402        }
403        regionCachedSize.clear();
404      } finally {
405        this.cacheState = CacheState.ENABLED;
406        startWriterThreads();
407      }
408    };
409    Thread t = new Thread(persistentCacheRetriever);
410    t.start();
411  }
412
413  private void sanityCheckConfigs() {
414    Preconditions.checkArgument(acceptableFactor <= 1 && acceptableFactor >= 0,
415      ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
416    Preconditions.checkArgument(minFactor <= 1 && minFactor >= 0,
417      MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
418    Preconditions.checkArgument(minFactor <= acceptableFactor,
419      MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be <= " + ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME);
420    Preconditions.checkArgument(extraFreeFactor >= 0,
421      EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be greater than 0.0");
422    Preconditions.checkArgument(singleFactor <= 1 && singleFactor >= 0,
423      SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
424    Preconditions.checkArgument(multiFactor <= 1 && multiFactor >= 0,
425      MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
426    Preconditions.checkArgument(memoryFactor <= 1 && memoryFactor >= 0,
427      MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " must be between 0.0 and 1.0");
428    Preconditions.checkArgument((singleFactor + multiFactor + memoryFactor) == 1,
429      SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + ", " + MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + ", and "
430        + MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " segments must add up to 1.0");
431  }
432
433  /**
434   * Called by the constructor to instantiate the writer threads.
435   */
436  private void instantiateWriterThreads() {
437    final String threadName = Thread.currentThread().getName();
438    for (int i = 0; i < this.writerThreads.length; ++i) {
439      this.writerThreads[i] = new WriterThread(this.writerQueues.get(i));
440      this.writerThreads[i].setName(threadName + "-BucketCacheWriter-" + i);
441      this.writerThreads[i].setDaemon(true);
442    }
443  }
444
445  /**
446   * Called by the constructor to start the writer threads. Used by tests that need to override
447   * starting the threads.
448   */
449  protected void startWriterThreads() {
450    for (WriterThread thread : writerThreads) {
451      thread.start();
452    }
453  }
454
455  void startBucketCachePersisterThread() {
456    LOG.info("Starting BucketCachePersisterThread");
457    cachePersister = new BucketCachePersister(this, bucketcachePersistInterval);
458    cachePersister.setDaemon(true);
459    cachePersister.start();
460  }
461
462  @Override
463  public boolean isCacheEnabled() {
464    return this.cacheState == CacheState.ENABLED;
465  }
466
467  @Override
468  public long getMaxSize() {
469    return this.cacheCapacity;
470  }
471
472  public String getIoEngine() {
473    return ioEngine.toString();
474  }
475
476  /**
477   * Get the IOEngine from the IO engine name
478   * @return the IOEngine
479   */
480  private IOEngine getIOEngineFromName(String ioEngineName, long capacity, String persistencePath)
481    throws IOException {
482    if (ioEngineName.startsWith("file:") || ioEngineName.startsWith("files:")) {
483      // In order to make the usage simple, we only need the prefix 'files:' in
484      // document whether one or multiple file(s), but also support 'file:' for
485      // the compatibility
486      String[] filePaths =
487        ioEngineName.substring(ioEngineName.indexOf(":") + 1).split(FileIOEngine.FILE_DELIMITER);
488      return new FileIOEngine(capacity, persistencePath != null, filePaths);
489    } else if (ioEngineName.startsWith("offheap")) {
490      return new ByteBufferIOEngine(capacity);
491    } else if (ioEngineName.startsWith("mmap:")) {
492      return new ExclusiveMemoryMmapIOEngine(ioEngineName.substring(5), capacity);
493    } else if (ioEngineName.startsWith("pmem:")) {
494      // This mode of bucket cache creates an IOEngine over a file on the persistent memory
495      // device. Since the persistent memory device has its own address space the contents
496      // mapped to this address space does not get swapped out like in the case of mmapping
497      // on to DRAM. Hence the cells created out of the hfile blocks in the pmem bucket cache
498      // can be directly referred to without having to copy them onheap. Once the RPC is done,
499      // the blocks can be returned back as in case of ByteBufferIOEngine.
500      return new SharedMemoryMmapIOEngine(ioEngineName.substring(5), capacity);
501    } else {
502      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
503        "Don't understand io engine name for cache- prefix with file:, files:, mmap: or offheap");
504    }
505  }
506
507  public boolean isCachePersistenceEnabled() {
508    return persistencePath != null;
509  }
510
511  /**
512   * Cache the block with the specified name and buffer.
513   * @param cacheKey block's cache key
514   * @param buf      block buffer
515   */
516  @Override
517  public void cacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable buf) {
518    cacheBlock(cacheKey, buf, false);
519  }
520
521  /**
522   * Cache the block with the specified name and buffer.
523   * @param cacheKey   block's cache key
524   * @param cachedItem block buffer
525   * @param inMemory   if block is in-memory
526   */
527  @Override
528  public void cacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable cachedItem, boolean inMemory) {
529    cacheBlockWithWait(cacheKey, cachedItem, inMemory, false);
530  }
531
532  /**
533   * Cache the block with the specified name and buffer.
534   * @param cacheKey   block's cache key
535   * @param cachedItem block buffer
536   * @param inMemory   if block is in-memory
537   */
538  @Override
539  public void cacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable cachedItem, boolean inMemory,
540    boolean waitWhenCache) {
541    cacheBlockWithWait(cacheKey, cachedItem, inMemory, waitWhenCache && queueAdditionWaitTime > 0);
542  }
543
544  /**
545   * Cache the block to ramCache
546   * @param cacheKey   block's cache key
547   * @param cachedItem block buffer
548   * @param inMemory   if block is in-memory
549   * @param wait       if true, blocking wait when queue is full
550   */
551  public void cacheBlockWithWait(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable cachedItem, boolean inMemory,
552    boolean wait) {
553    if (isCacheEnabled()) {
554      if (backingMap.containsKey(cacheKey) || ramCache.containsKey(cacheKey)) {
555        if (shouldReplaceExistingCacheBlock(cacheKey, cachedItem)) {
556          BucketEntry bucketEntry = backingMap.get(cacheKey);
557          if (bucketEntry != null && bucketEntry.isRpcRef()) {
558            // avoid replace when there are RPC refs for the bucket entry in bucket cache
559            return;
560          }
561          cacheBlockWithWaitInternal(cacheKey, cachedItem, inMemory, wait);
562        }
563      } else {
564        cacheBlockWithWaitInternal(cacheKey, cachedItem, inMemory, wait);
565      }
566    }
567  }
568
569  protected boolean shouldReplaceExistingCacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable newBlock) {
570    return BlockCacheUtil.shouldReplaceExistingCacheBlock(this, cacheKey, newBlock);
571  }
572
573  protected void cacheBlockWithWaitInternal(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable cachedItem,
574    boolean inMemory, boolean wait) {
575    if (!isCacheEnabled()) {
576      return;
577    }
578    if (cacheKey.getBlockType() == null && cachedItem.getBlockType() != null) {
579      cacheKey.setBlockType(cachedItem.getBlockType());
580    }
581    LOG.trace("Caching key={}, item={}", cacheKey, cachedItem);
582    // Stuff the entry into the RAM cache so it can get drained to the persistent store
583    RAMQueueEntry re = new RAMQueueEntry(cacheKey, cachedItem, accessCount.incrementAndGet(),
584      inMemory, isCachePersistent() && ioEngine instanceof FileIOEngine);
585    /**
586     * Don't use ramCache.put(cacheKey, re) here. because there may be a existing entry with same
587     * key in ramCache, the heap size of bucket cache need to update if replacing entry from
588     * ramCache. But WriterThread will also remove entry from ramCache and update heap size, if
589     * using ramCache.put(), It's possible that the removed entry in WriterThread is not the correct
590     * one, then the heap size will mess up (HBASE-20789)
591     */
592    if (ramCache.putIfAbsent(cacheKey, re) != null) {
593      return;
594    }
595    int queueNum = (cacheKey.hashCode() & 0x7FFFFFFF) % writerQueues.size();
596    BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry> bq = writerQueues.get(queueNum);
597    boolean successfulAddition = false;
598    if (wait) {
599      try {
600        successfulAddition = bq.offer(re, queueAdditionWaitTime, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
601      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
602        Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
603      }
604    } else {
605      successfulAddition = bq.offer(re);
606    }
607    if (!successfulAddition) {
608      ramCache.remove(cacheKey);
609      cacheStats.failInsert();
610    } else {
611      this.blockNumber.increment();
612      this.heapSize.add(cachedItem.heapSize());
613    }
614  }
615
616  /**
617   * If the passed cache key relates to a reference (&lt;hfile&gt;.&lt;parentEncRegion&gt;), this
618   * method looks for the block from the referred file, in the cache. If present in the cache, the
619   * block for the referred file is returned, otherwise, this method returns null. It will also
620   * return null if the passed cache key doesn't relate to a reference.
621   * @param key the BlockCacheKey instance to look for in the cache.
622   * @return the cached block from the referred file, null if there's no such block in the cache or
623   *         the passed key doesn't relate to a reference.
624   */
625  public BucketEntry getBlockForReference(BlockCacheKey key) {
626    BucketEntry foundEntry = null;
627    String referredFileName = null;
628    if (StoreFileInfo.isReference(key.getHfileName())) {
629      referredFileName = StoreFileInfo.getReferredToRegionAndFile(key.getHfileName()).getSecond();
630    }
631    if (referredFileName != null) {
632      BlockCacheKey convertedCacheKey = new BlockCacheKey(referredFileName, key.getOffset());
633      foundEntry = backingMap.get(convertedCacheKey);
634      LOG.debug("Got a link/ref: {}. Related cacheKey: {}. Found entry: {}", key.getHfileName(),
635        convertedCacheKey, foundEntry);
636    }
637    return foundEntry;
638  }
639
640  /**
641   * Get the buffer of the block with the specified key.
642   * @param key                block's cache key
643   * @param caching            true if the caller caches blocks on cache misses
644   * @param repeat             Whether this is a repeat lookup for the same block
645   * @param updateCacheMetrics Whether we should update cache metrics or not
646   * @return buffer of specified cache key, or null if not in cache
647   */
648  @Override
649  public Cacheable getBlock(BlockCacheKey key, boolean caching, boolean repeat,
650    boolean updateCacheMetrics) {
651    if (!isCacheEnabled()) {
652      return null;
653    }
654    RAMQueueEntry re = ramCache.get(key);
655    if (re != null) {
656      if (updateCacheMetrics) {
657        cacheStats.hit(caching, key.isPrimary(), key.getBlockType());
658      }
659      re.access(accessCount.incrementAndGet());
660      return re.getData();
661    }
662    BucketEntry bucketEntry = backingMap.get(key);
663    if (bucketEntry == null) {
664      bucketEntry = getBlockForReference(key);
665    }
666    if (bucketEntry != null) {
667      long start = System.nanoTime();
668      ReentrantReadWriteLock lock = offsetLock.getLock(bucketEntry.offset());
669      try {
670        lock.readLock().lock();
671        // We can not read here even if backingMap does contain the given key because its offset
672        // maybe changed. If we lock BlockCacheKey instead of offset, then we can only check
673        // existence here.
674        if (
675          bucketEntry.equals(backingMap.get(key)) || bucketEntry.equals(getBlockForReference(key))
676        ) {
677          // Read the block from IOEngine based on the bucketEntry's offset and length, NOTICE: the
678          // block will use the refCnt of bucketEntry, which means if two HFileBlock mapping to
679          // the same BucketEntry, then all of the three will share the same refCnt.
680          Cacheable cachedBlock = ioEngine.read(bucketEntry);
681          if (ioEngine.usesSharedMemory()) {
682            // If IOEngine use shared memory, cachedBlock and BucketEntry will share the
683            // same RefCnt, do retain here, in order to count the number of RPC references
684            cachedBlock.retain();
685          }
686          // Update the cache statistics.
687          if (updateCacheMetrics) {
688            cacheStats.hit(caching, key.isPrimary(), key.getBlockType());
689            cacheStats.ioHit(System.nanoTime() - start);
690          }
691          bucketEntry.access(accessCount.incrementAndGet());
692          if (this.ioErrorStartTime > 0) {
693            ioErrorStartTime = -1;
694          }
695          return cachedBlock;
696        }
697      } catch (HBaseIOException hioex) {
698        // When using file io engine persistent cache,
699        // the cache map state might differ from the actual cache. If we reach this block,
700        // we should remove the cache key entry from the backing map
701        backingMap.remove(key);
702        fullyCachedFiles.remove(key.getHfileName());
703        LOG.debug("Failed to fetch block for cache key: {}.", key, hioex);
704      } catch (IOException ioex) {
705        LOG.error("Failed reading block " + key + " from bucket cache", ioex);
706        checkIOErrorIsTolerated();
707      } finally {
708        lock.readLock().unlock();
709      }
710    }
711    if (!repeat && updateCacheMetrics) {
712      cacheStats.miss(caching, key.isPrimary(), key.getBlockType());
713    }
714    return null;
715  }
716
717  /**
718   * This method is invoked after the bucketEntry is removed from {@link BucketCache#backingMap}
719   */
720  void blockEvicted(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, BucketEntry bucketEntry, boolean decrementBlockNumber,
721    boolean evictedByEvictionProcess) {
722    bucketEntry.markAsEvicted();
723    blocksByHFile.remove(cacheKey);
724    if (decrementBlockNumber) {
725      this.blockNumber.decrement();
726      if (ioEngine.isPersistent()) {
727        fileNotFullyCached(cacheKey.getHfileName());
728      }
729    }
730    if (evictedByEvictionProcess) {
731      cacheStats.evicted(bucketEntry.getCachedTime(), cacheKey.isPrimary());
732    }
733    if (ioEngine.isPersistent()) {
734      setCacheInconsistent(true);
735    }
736  }
737
738  private void fileNotFullyCached(String hfileName) {
739    // Update the regionPrefetchedSizeMap before removing the file from prefetchCompleted
740    if (fullyCachedFiles.containsKey(hfileName)) {
741      Pair<String, Long> regionEntry = fullyCachedFiles.get(hfileName);
742      String regionEncodedName = regionEntry.getFirst();
743      long filePrefetchSize = regionEntry.getSecond();
744      LOG.debug("Removing file {} for region {}", hfileName, regionEncodedName);
745      regionCachedSize.computeIfPresent(regionEncodedName, (rn, pf) -> pf - filePrefetchSize);
746      // If all the blocks for a region are evicted from the cache, remove the entry for that region
747      if (
748        regionCachedSize.containsKey(regionEncodedName)
749          && regionCachedSize.get(regionEncodedName) == 0
750      ) {
751        regionCachedSize.remove(regionEncodedName);
752      }
753    }
754    fullyCachedFiles.remove(hfileName);
755  }
756
757  public void fileCacheCompleted(Path filePath, long size) {
758    Pair<String, Long> pair = new Pair<>();
759    // sets the region name
760    String regionName = filePath.getParent().getParent().getName();
761    pair.setFirst(regionName);
762    pair.setSecond(size);
763    fullyCachedFiles.put(filePath.getName(), pair);
764  }
765
766  private void updateRegionCachedSize(Path filePath, long cachedSize) {
767    if (filePath != null) {
768      String regionName = filePath.getParent().getParent().getName();
769      regionCachedSize.merge(regionName, cachedSize,
770        (previousSize, newBlockSize) -> previousSize + newBlockSize);
771    }
772  }
773
774  /**
775   * Free the {{@link BucketEntry} actually,which could only be invoked when the
776   * {@link BucketEntry#refCnt} becoming 0.
777   */
778  void freeBucketEntry(BucketEntry bucketEntry) {
779    bucketAllocator.freeBlock(bucketEntry.offset(), bucketEntry.getLength());
780    realCacheSize.add(-1 * bucketEntry.getLength());
781  }
782
783  /**
784   * Try to evict the block from {@link BlockCache} by force. We'll call this in few cases:<br>
785   * 1. Close an HFile, and clear all cached blocks. <br>
786   * 2. Call {@link Admin#clearBlockCache(TableName)} to clear all blocks for a given table.<br>
787   * <p>
788   * Firstly, we'll try to remove the block from RAMCache,and then try to evict from backingMap.
789   * Here we evict the block from backingMap immediately, but only free the reference from bucket
790   * cache by calling {@link BucketEntry#markedAsEvicted}. If there're still some RPC referring this
791   * block, block can only be de-allocated when all of them release the block.
792   * <p>
793   * NOTICE: we need to grab the write offset lock firstly before releasing the reference from
794   * bucket cache. if we don't, we may read an {@link BucketEntry} with refCnt = 0 when
795   * {@link BucketCache#getBlock(BlockCacheKey, boolean, boolean, boolean)}, it's a memory leak.
796   * @param cacheKey Block to evict
797   * @return true to indicate whether we've evicted successfully or not.
798   */
799  @Override
800  public boolean evictBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey) {
801    return doEvictBlock(cacheKey, null, false);
802  }
803
804  /**
805   * Evict the {@link BlockCacheKey} and {@link BucketEntry} from {@link BucketCache#backingMap} and
806   * {@link BucketCache#ramCache}. <br/>
807   * NOTE:When Evict from {@link BucketCache#backingMap},only the matched {@link BlockCacheKey} and
808   * {@link BucketEntry} could be removed.
809   * @param cacheKey    {@link BlockCacheKey} to evict.
810   * @param bucketEntry {@link BucketEntry} matched {@link BlockCacheKey} to evict.
811   * @return true to indicate whether we've evicted successfully or not.
812   */
813  private boolean doEvictBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, BucketEntry bucketEntry,
814    boolean evictedByEvictionProcess) {
815    if (!isCacheEnabled()) {
816      return false;
817    }
818    boolean existedInRamCache = removeFromRamCache(cacheKey);
819    if (bucketEntry == null) {
820      bucketEntry = backingMap.get(cacheKey);
821    }
822    final BucketEntry bucketEntryToUse = bucketEntry;
823
824    if (bucketEntryToUse == null) {
825      if (existedInRamCache && evictedByEvictionProcess) {
826        cacheStats.evicted(0, cacheKey.isPrimary());
827      }
828      return existedInRamCache;
829    } else {
830      return bucketEntryToUse.withWriteLock(offsetLock, () -> {
831        if (backingMap.remove(cacheKey, bucketEntryToUse)) {
832          LOG.debug("removed key {} from back map with offset lock {} in the evict process",
833            cacheKey, bucketEntryToUse.offset());
834          blockEvicted(cacheKey, bucketEntryToUse, !existedInRamCache, evictedByEvictionProcess);
835          return true;
836        }
837        return false;
838      });
839    }
840  }
841
842  /**
843   * <pre>
844   * Create the {@link Recycler} for {@link BucketEntry#refCnt},which would be used as
845   * {@link RefCnt#recycler} of {@link HFileBlock#buf} returned from {@link BucketCache#getBlock}.
846   * NOTE: for {@link BucketCache#getBlock},the {@link RefCnt#recycler} of {@link HFileBlock#buf}
847   * from {@link BucketCache#backingMap} and {@link BucketCache#ramCache} are different:
848   * 1.For {@link RefCnt#recycler} of {@link HFileBlock#buf} from {@link BucketCache#backingMap},
849   *   it is the return value of current {@link BucketCache#createRecycler} method.
850   *
851   * 2.For {@link RefCnt#recycler} of {@link HFileBlock#buf} from {@link BucketCache#ramCache},
852   *   it is {@link ByteBuffAllocator#putbackBuffer}.
853   * </pre>
854   */
855  private Recycler createRecycler(final BucketEntry bucketEntry) {
856    return () -> {
857      freeBucketEntry(bucketEntry);
858      return;
859    };
860  }
861
862  /**
863   * NOTE: This method is only for test.
864   */
865  public boolean evictBlockIfNoRpcReferenced(BlockCacheKey blockCacheKey) {
866    BucketEntry bucketEntry = backingMap.get(blockCacheKey);
867    if (bucketEntry == null) {
868      return false;
869    }
870    return evictBucketEntryIfNoRpcReferenced(blockCacheKey, bucketEntry);
871  }
872
873  /**
874   * Evict {@link BlockCacheKey} and its corresponding {@link BucketEntry} only if
875   * {@link BucketEntry#isRpcRef} is false. <br/>
876   * NOTE:When evict from {@link BucketCache#backingMap},only the matched {@link BlockCacheKey} and
877   * {@link BucketEntry} could be removed.
878   * @param blockCacheKey {@link BlockCacheKey} to evict.
879   * @param bucketEntry   {@link BucketEntry} matched {@link BlockCacheKey} to evict.
880   * @return true to indicate whether we've evicted successfully or not.
881   */
882  boolean evictBucketEntryIfNoRpcReferenced(BlockCacheKey blockCacheKey, BucketEntry bucketEntry) {
883    if (!bucketEntry.isRpcRef()) {
884      return doEvictBlock(blockCacheKey, bucketEntry, true);
885    }
886    return false;
887  }
888
889  protected boolean removeFromRamCache(BlockCacheKey cacheKey) {
890    return ramCache.remove(cacheKey, re -> {
891      if (re != null) {
892        this.blockNumber.decrement();
893        this.heapSize.add(-1 * re.getData().heapSize());
894      }
895    });
896  }
897
898  public boolean isCacheInconsistent() {
899    return isCacheInconsistent.get();
900  }
901
902  public void setCacheInconsistent(boolean setCacheInconsistent) {
903    isCacheInconsistent.set(setCacheInconsistent);
904  }
905
906  protected void setCacheState(CacheState state) {
907    cacheState = state;
908  }
909
910  /*
911   * Statistics thread. Periodically output cache statistics to the log.
912   */
913  private static class StatisticsThread extends Thread {
914    private final BucketCache bucketCache;
915
916    public StatisticsThread(BucketCache bucketCache) {
917      super("BucketCacheStatsThread");
918      setDaemon(true);
919      this.bucketCache = bucketCache;
920    }
921
922    @Override
923    public void run() {
924      bucketCache.logStats();
925    }
926  }
927
928  public void logStats() {
929    if (!isCacheInitialized("BucketCache::logStats")) {
930      return;
931    }
932
933    long totalSize = bucketAllocator.getTotalSize();
934    long usedSize = bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
935    long freeSize = totalSize - usedSize;
936    long cacheSize = getRealCacheSize();
937    LOG.info("failedBlockAdditions=" + cacheStats.getFailedInserts() + ", " + "totalSize="
938      + StringUtils.byteDesc(totalSize) + ", " + "freeSize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(freeSize) + ", "
939      + "usedSize=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(usedSize) + ", " + "cacheSize="
940      + StringUtils.byteDesc(cacheSize) + ", " + "accesses=" + cacheStats.getRequestCount() + ", "
941      + "hits=" + cacheStats.getHitCount() + ", " + "IOhitsPerSecond="
942      + cacheStats.getIOHitsPerSecond() + ", " + "IOTimePerHit="
943      + String.format("%.2f", cacheStats.getIOTimePerHit()) + ", " + "hitRatio="
944      + (cacheStats.getHitCount() == 0
945        ? "0,"
946        : (StringUtils.formatPercent(cacheStats.getHitRatio(), 2) + ", "))
947      + "cachingAccesses=" + cacheStats.getRequestCachingCount() + ", " + "cachingHits="
948      + cacheStats.getHitCachingCount() + ", " + "cachingHitsRatio="
949      + (cacheStats.getHitCachingCount() == 0
950        ? "0,"
951        : (StringUtils.formatPercent(cacheStats.getHitCachingRatio(), 2) + ", "))
952      + "evictions=" + cacheStats.getEvictionCount() + ", " + "evicted="
953      + cacheStats.getEvictedCount() + ", " + "evictedPerRun=" + cacheStats.evictedPerEviction()
954      + ", " + "allocationFailCount=" + cacheStats.getAllocationFailCount());
955    cacheStats.reset();
956
957    bucketAllocator.logDebugStatistics();
958  }
959
960  public long getRealCacheSize() {
961    return this.realCacheSize.sum();
962  }
963
964  public long acceptableSize() {
965    if (!isCacheInitialized("BucketCache::acceptableSize")) {
966      return 0;
967    }
968    return (long) Math.floor(bucketAllocator.getTotalSize() * acceptableFactor);
969  }
970
971  long getPartitionSize(float partitionFactor) {
972    if (!isCacheInitialized("BucketCache::getPartitionSize")) {
973      return 0;
974    }
975
976    return (long) Math.floor(bucketAllocator.getTotalSize() * partitionFactor * minFactor);
977  }
978
979  /**
980   * Return the count of bucketSizeinfos still need free space
981   */
982  private int bucketSizesAboveThresholdCount(float minFactor) {
983    if (!isCacheInitialized("BucketCache::bucketSizesAboveThresholdCount")) {
984      return 0;
985    }
986
987    BucketAllocator.IndexStatistics[] stats = bucketAllocator.getIndexStatistics();
988    int fullCount = 0;
989    for (int i = 0; i < stats.length; i++) {
990      long freeGoal = (long) Math.floor(stats[i].totalCount() * (1 - minFactor));
991      freeGoal = Math.max(freeGoal, 1);
992      if (stats[i].freeCount() < freeGoal) {
993        fullCount++;
994      }
995    }
996    return fullCount;
997  }
998
999  /**
1000   * This method will find the buckets that are minimally occupied and are not reference counted and
1001   * will free them completely without any constraint on the access times of the elements, and as a
1002   * process will completely free at most the number of buckets passed, sometimes it might not due
1003   * to changing refCounts
1004   * @param completelyFreeBucketsNeeded number of buckets to free
1005   **/
1006  private void freeEntireBuckets(int completelyFreeBucketsNeeded) {
1007    if (!isCacheInitialized("BucketCache::freeEntireBuckets")) {
1008      return;
1009    }
1010
1011    if (completelyFreeBucketsNeeded != 0) {
1012      // First we will build a set where the offsets are reference counted, usually
1013      // this set is small around O(Handler Count) unless something else is wrong
1014      Set<Integer> inUseBuckets = new HashSet<>();
1015      backingMap.forEach((k, be) -> {
1016        if (be.isRpcRef()) {
1017          inUseBuckets.add(bucketAllocator.getBucketIndex(be.offset()));
1018        }
1019      });
1020      Set<Integer> candidateBuckets =
1021        bucketAllocator.getLeastFilledBuckets(inUseBuckets, completelyFreeBucketsNeeded);
1022      for (Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> entry : backingMap.entrySet()) {
1023        if (candidateBuckets.contains(bucketAllocator.getBucketIndex(entry.getValue().offset()))) {
1024          evictBucketEntryIfNoRpcReferenced(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
1025        }
1026      }
1027    }
1028  }
1029
1030  /**
1031   * Free the space if the used size reaches acceptableSize() or one size block couldn't be
1032   * allocated. When freeing the space, we use the LRU algorithm and ensure there must be some
1033   * blocks evicted
1034   * @param why Why we are being called
1035   */
1036  void freeSpace(final String why) {
1037    if (!isCacheInitialized("BucketCache::freeSpace")) {
1038      return;
1039    }
1040    // Ensure only one freeSpace progress at a time
1041    if (!freeSpaceLock.tryLock()) {
1042      return;
1043    }
1044    try {
1045      freeInProgress = true;
1046      long bytesToFreeWithoutExtra = 0;
1047      // Calculate free byte for each bucketSizeinfo
1048      StringBuilder msgBuffer = LOG.isDebugEnabled() ? new StringBuilder() : null;
1049      BucketAllocator.IndexStatistics[] stats = bucketAllocator.getIndexStatistics();
1050      long[] bytesToFreeForBucket = new long[stats.length];
1051      for (int i = 0; i < stats.length; i++) {
1052        bytesToFreeForBucket[i] = 0;
1053        long freeGoal = (long) Math.floor(stats[i].totalCount() * (1 - minFactor));
1054        freeGoal = Math.max(freeGoal, 1);
1055        if (stats[i].freeCount() < freeGoal) {
1056          bytesToFreeForBucket[i] = stats[i].itemSize() * (freeGoal - stats[i].freeCount());
1057          bytesToFreeWithoutExtra += bytesToFreeForBucket[i];
1058          if (msgBuffer != null) {
1059            msgBuffer.append("Free for bucketSize(" + stats[i].itemSize() + ")="
1060              + StringUtils.byteDesc(bytesToFreeForBucket[i]) + ", ");
1061          }
1062        }
1063      }
1064      if (msgBuffer != null) {
1065        msgBuffer.append("Free for total=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(bytesToFreeWithoutExtra) + ", ");
1066      }
1067
1068      if (bytesToFreeWithoutExtra <= 0) {
1069        return;
1070      }
1071      long currentSize = bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
1072      long totalSize = bucketAllocator.getTotalSize();
1073      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled() && msgBuffer != null) {
1074        LOG.debug("Free started because \"" + why + "\"; " + msgBuffer.toString()
1075          + " of current used=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(currentSize) + ", actual cacheSize="
1076          + StringUtils.byteDesc(realCacheSize.sum()) + ", total="
1077          + StringUtils.byteDesc(totalSize));
1078      }
1079
1080      long bytesToFreeWithExtra =
1081        (long) Math.floor(bytesToFreeWithoutExtra * (1 + extraFreeFactor));
1082
1083      // Instantiate priority buckets
1084      BucketEntryGroup bucketSingle =
1085        new BucketEntryGroup(bytesToFreeWithExtra, blockSize, getPartitionSize(singleFactor));
1086      BucketEntryGroup bucketMulti =
1087        new BucketEntryGroup(bytesToFreeWithExtra, blockSize, getPartitionSize(multiFactor));
1088      BucketEntryGroup bucketMemory =
1089        new BucketEntryGroup(bytesToFreeWithExtra, blockSize, getPartitionSize(memoryFactor));
1090
1091      // Scan entire map putting bucket entry into appropriate bucket entry
1092      // group
1093      for (Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> bucketEntryWithKey : backingMap.entrySet()) {
1094        switch (bucketEntryWithKey.getValue().getPriority()) {
1095          case SINGLE: {
1096            bucketSingle.add(bucketEntryWithKey);
1097            break;
1098          }
1099          case MULTI: {
1100            bucketMulti.add(bucketEntryWithKey);
1101            break;
1102          }
1103          case MEMORY: {
1104            bucketMemory.add(bucketEntryWithKey);
1105            break;
1106          }
1107        }
1108      }
1109
1110      PriorityQueue<BucketEntryGroup> bucketQueue =
1111        new PriorityQueue<>(3, Comparator.comparingLong(BucketEntryGroup::overflow));
1112
1113      bucketQueue.add(bucketSingle);
1114      bucketQueue.add(bucketMulti);
1115      bucketQueue.add(bucketMemory);
1116
1117      int remainingBuckets = bucketQueue.size();
1118      long bytesFreed = 0;
1119
1120      BucketEntryGroup bucketGroup;
1121      while ((bucketGroup = bucketQueue.poll()) != null) {
1122        long overflow = bucketGroup.overflow();
1123        if (overflow > 0) {
1124          long bucketBytesToFree =
1125            Math.min(overflow, (bytesToFreeWithoutExtra - bytesFreed) / remainingBuckets);
1126          bytesFreed += bucketGroup.free(bucketBytesToFree);
1127        }
1128        remainingBuckets--;
1129      }
1130
1131      // Check and free if there are buckets that still need freeing of space
1132      if (bucketSizesAboveThresholdCount(minFactor) > 0) {
1133        bucketQueue.clear();
1134        remainingBuckets = 3;
1135
1136        bucketQueue.add(bucketSingle);
1137        bucketQueue.add(bucketMulti);
1138        bucketQueue.add(bucketMemory);
1139
1140        while ((bucketGroup = bucketQueue.poll()) != null) {
1141          long bucketBytesToFree = (bytesToFreeWithExtra - bytesFreed) / remainingBuckets;
1142          bytesFreed += bucketGroup.free(bucketBytesToFree);
1143          remainingBuckets--;
1144        }
1145      }
1146
1147      // Even after the above free we might still need freeing because of the
1148      // De-fragmentation of the buckets (also called Slab Calcification problem), i.e
1149      // there might be some buckets where the occupancy is very sparse and thus are not
1150      // yielding the free for the other bucket sizes, the fix for this to evict some
1151      // of the buckets, we do this by evicting the buckets that are least fulled
1152      freeEntireBuckets(DEFAULT_FREE_ENTIRE_BLOCK_FACTOR * bucketSizesAboveThresholdCount(1.0f));
1153
1154      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1155        long single = bucketSingle.totalSize();
1156        long multi = bucketMulti.totalSize();
1157        long memory = bucketMemory.totalSize();
1158        if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1159          LOG.debug("Bucket cache free space completed; " + "freed="
1160            + StringUtils.byteDesc(bytesFreed) + ", " + "total=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(totalSize)
1161            + ", " + "single=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(single) + ", " + "multi="
1162            + StringUtils.byteDesc(multi) + ", " + "memory=" + StringUtils.byteDesc(memory));
1163        }
1164      }
1165
1166    } catch (Throwable t) {
1167      LOG.warn("Failed freeing space", t);
1168    } finally {
1169      cacheStats.evict();
1170      freeInProgress = false;
1171      freeSpaceLock.unlock();
1172    }
1173  }
1174
1175  // This handles flushing the RAM cache to IOEngine.
1176  class WriterThread extends Thread {
1177    private final BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry> inputQueue;
1178    private volatile boolean writerEnabled = true;
1179    private final ByteBuffer metaBuff = ByteBuffer.allocate(HFileBlock.BLOCK_METADATA_SPACE);
1180
1181    WriterThread(BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry> queue) {
1182      super("BucketCacheWriterThread");
1183      this.inputQueue = queue;
1184    }
1185
1186    // Used for test
1187    void disableWriter() {
1188      this.writerEnabled = false;
1189    }
1190
1191    @Override
1192    public void run() {
1193      List<RAMQueueEntry> entries = new ArrayList<>();
1194      try {
1195        while (isCacheEnabled() && writerEnabled) {
1196          try {
1197            try {
1198              // Blocks
1199              entries = getRAMQueueEntries(inputQueue, entries);
1200            } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
1201              if (!isCacheEnabled() || !writerEnabled) {
1202                break;
1203              }
1204            }
1205            doDrain(entries, metaBuff);
1206          } catch (Exception ioe) {
1207            LOG.error("WriterThread encountered error", ioe);
1208          }
1209        }
1210      } catch (Throwable t) {
1211        LOG.warn("Failed doing drain", t);
1212      }
1213      LOG.info(this.getName() + " exiting, cacheEnabled=" + isCacheEnabled());
1214    }
1215  }
1216
1217  /**
1218   * Put the new bucket entry into backingMap. Notice that we are allowed to replace the existing
1219   * cache with a new block for the same cache key. there's a corner case: one thread cache a block
1220   * in ramCache, copy to io-engine and add a bucket entry to backingMap. Caching another new block
1221   * with the same cache key do the same thing for the same cache key, so if not evict the previous
1222   * bucket entry, then memory leak happen because the previous bucketEntry is gone but the
1223   * bucketAllocator do not free its memory.
1224   * @see BlockCacheUtil#shouldReplaceExistingCacheBlock(BlockCache blockCache,BlockCacheKey
1225   *      cacheKey, Cacheable newBlock)
1226   * @param key         Block cache key
1227   * @param bucketEntry Bucket entry to put into backingMap.
1228   */
1229  protected void putIntoBackingMap(BlockCacheKey key, BucketEntry bucketEntry) {
1230    BucketEntry previousEntry = backingMap.put(key, bucketEntry);
1231    blocksByHFile.add(key);
1232    updateRegionCachedSize(key.getFilePath(), bucketEntry.getLength());
1233    if (previousEntry != null && previousEntry != bucketEntry) {
1234      previousEntry.withWriteLock(offsetLock, () -> {
1235        blockEvicted(key, previousEntry, false, false);
1236        return null;
1237      });
1238    }
1239  }
1240
1241  /**
1242   * Prepare and return a warning message for Bucket Allocator Exception
1243   * @param fle The exception
1244   * @param re  The RAMQueueEntry for which the exception was thrown.
1245   * @return A warning message created from the input RAMQueueEntry object.
1246   */
1247  private static String getAllocationFailWarningMessage(final BucketAllocatorException fle,
1248    final RAMQueueEntry re) {
1249    final StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1250    sb.append("Most recent failed allocation after ");
1251    sb.append(ALLOCATION_FAIL_LOG_TIME_PERIOD);
1252    sb.append(" ms;");
1253    if (re != null) {
1254      if (re.getData() instanceof HFileBlock) {
1255        final HFileContext fileContext = ((HFileBlock) re.getData()).getHFileContext();
1256        final String columnFamily = Bytes.toString(fileContext.getColumnFamily());
1257        final String tableName = Bytes.toString(fileContext.getTableName());
1258        if (tableName != null) {
1259          sb.append(" Table: ");
1260          sb.append(tableName);
1261        }
1262        if (columnFamily != null) {
1263          sb.append(" CF: ");
1264          sb.append(columnFamily);
1265        }
1266        sb.append(" HFile: ");
1267        if (fileContext.getHFileName() != null) {
1268          sb.append(fileContext.getHFileName());
1269        } else {
1270          sb.append(re.getKey());
1271        }
1272      } else {
1273        sb.append(" HFile: ");
1274        sb.append(re.getKey());
1275      }
1276    }
1277    sb.append(" Message: ");
1278    sb.append(fle.getMessage());
1279    return sb.toString();
1280  }
1281
1282  /**
1283   * Flush the entries in ramCache to IOEngine and add bucket entry to backingMap. Process all that
1284   * are passed in even if failure being sure to remove from ramCache else we'll never undo the
1285   * references and we'll OOME.
1286   * @param entries Presumes list passed in here will be processed by this invocation only. No
1287   *                interference expected.
1288   */
1289  void doDrain(final List<RAMQueueEntry> entries, ByteBuffer metaBuff) throws InterruptedException {
1290    if (entries.isEmpty()) {
1291      return;
1292    }
1293    // This method is a little hard to follow. We run through the passed in entries and for each
1294    // successful add, we add a non-null BucketEntry to the below bucketEntries. Later we must
1295    // do cleanup making sure we've cleared ramCache of all entries regardless of whether we
1296    // successfully added the item to the bucketcache; if we don't do the cleanup, we'll OOME by
1297    // filling ramCache. We do the clean up by again running through the passed in entries
1298    // doing extra work when we find a non-null bucketEntries corresponding entry.
1299    final int size = entries.size();
1300    BucketEntry[] bucketEntries = new BucketEntry[size];
1301    // Index updated inside loop if success or if we can't succeed. We retry if cache is full
1302    // when we go to add an entry by going around the loop again without upping the index.
1303    int index = 0;
1304    while (isCacheEnabled() && index < size) {
1305      RAMQueueEntry re = null;
1306      try {
1307        re = entries.get(index);
1308        if (re == null) {
1309          LOG.warn("Couldn't get entry or changed on us; who else is messing with it?");
1310          index++;
1311          continue;
1312        }
1313        // Reset the position for reuse.
1314        // It should be guaranteed that the data in the metaBuff has been transferred to the
1315        // ioEngine safely. Otherwise, this reuse is problematic. Fortunately, the data is already
1316        // transferred with our current IOEngines. Should take care, when we have new kinds of
1317        // IOEngine in the future.
1318        metaBuff.clear();
1319        BucketEntry bucketEntry =
1320          re.writeToCache(ioEngine, bucketAllocator, realCacheSize, this::createRecycler, metaBuff);
1321        // Successfully added. Up index and add bucketEntry. Clear io exceptions.
1322        bucketEntries[index] = bucketEntry;
1323        if (ioErrorStartTime > 0) {
1324          ioErrorStartTime = -1;
1325        }
1326        index++;
1327      } catch (BucketAllocatorException fle) {
1328        long currTs = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1329        cacheStats.allocationFailed(); // Record the warning.
1330        if (
1331          allocFailLogPrevTs == 0 || (currTs - allocFailLogPrevTs) > ALLOCATION_FAIL_LOG_TIME_PERIOD
1332        ) {
1333          LOG.warn(getAllocationFailWarningMessage(fle, re));
1334          allocFailLogPrevTs = currTs;
1335        }
1336        // Presume can't add. Too big? Move index on. Entry will be cleared from ramCache below.
1337        bucketEntries[index] = null;
1338        index++;
1339      } catch (CacheFullException cfe) {
1340        // Cache full when we tried to add. Try freeing space and then retrying (don't up index)
1341        if (!freeInProgress) {
1342          freeSpace("Full!");
1343        } else {
1344          Thread.sleep(50);
1345        }
1346      } catch (IOException ioex) {
1347        // Hopefully transient. Retry. checkIOErrorIsTolerated disables cache if problem.
1348        LOG.error("Failed writing to bucket cache", ioex);
1349        checkIOErrorIsTolerated();
1350      }
1351    }
1352
1353    // Make sure data pages are written on media before we update maps.
1354    try {
1355      ioEngine.sync();
1356    } catch (IOException ioex) {
1357      LOG.error("Failed syncing IO engine", ioex);
1358      checkIOErrorIsTolerated();
1359      // Since we failed sync, free the blocks in bucket allocator
1360      for (int i = 0; i < entries.size(); ++i) {
1361        BucketEntry bucketEntry = bucketEntries[i];
1362        if (bucketEntry != null) {
1363          bucketAllocator.freeBlock(bucketEntry.offset(), bucketEntry.getLength());
1364          bucketEntries[i] = null;
1365        }
1366      }
1367    }
1368
1369    // Now add to backingMap if successfully added to bucket cache. Remove from ramCache if
1370    // success or error.
1371    for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
1372      BlockCacheKey key = entries.get(i).getKey();
1373      // Only add if non-null entry.
1374      if (bucketEntries[i] != null) {
1375        putIntoBackingMap(key, bucketEntries[i]);
1376        if (ioEngine.isPersistent()) {
1377          setCacheInconsistent(true);
1378        }
1379      }
1380      // Always remove from ramCache even if we failed adding it to the block cache above.
1381      boolean existed = ramCache.remove(key, re -> {
1382        if (re != null) {
1383          heapSize.add(-1 * re.getData().heapSize());
1384        }
1385      });
1386      if (!existed && bucketEntries[i] != null) {
1387        // Block should have already been evicted. Remove it and free space.
1388        final BucketEntry bucketEntry = bucketEntries[i];
1389        bucketEntry.withWriteLock(offsetLock, () -> {
1390          if (backingMap.remove(key, bucketEntry)) {
1391            blockEvicted(key, bucketEntry, false, false);
1392          }
1393          return null;
1394        });
1395      }
1396    }
1397
1398    long used = bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
1399    if (used > acceptableSize()) {
1400      freeSpace("Used=" + used + " > acceptable=" + acceptableSize());
1401    }
1402    return;
1403  }
1404
1405  /**
1406   * Blocks until elements available in {@code q} then tries to grab as many as possible before
1407   * returning.
1408   * @param receptacle Where to stash the elements taken from queue. We clear before we use it just
1409   *                   in case.
1410   * @param q          The queue to take from.
1411   * @return {@code receptacle} laden with elements taken from the queue or empty if none found.
1412   */
1413  static List<RAMQueueEntry> getRAMQueueEntries(BlockingQueue<RAMQueueEntry> q,
1414    List<RAMQueueEntry> receptacle) throws InterruptedException {
1415    // Clear sets all entries to null and sets size to 0. We retain allocations. Presume it
1416    // ok even if list grew to accommodate thousands.
1417    receptacle.clear();
1418    receptacle.add(q.take());
1419    q.drainTo(receptacle);
1420    return receptacle;
1421  }
1422
1423  /**
1424   * @see #retrieveFromFile(int[])
1425   */
1426  @edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressWarnings(value = "OBL_UNSATISFIED_OBLIGATION",
1427      justification = "false positive, try-with-resources ensures close is called.")
1428  void persistToFile() throws IOException {
1429    LOG.debug("Thread {} started persisting bucket cache to file",
1430      Thread.currentThread().getName());
1431    if (!isCachePersistent()) {
1432      throw new IOException("Attempt to persist non-persistent cache mappings!");
1433    }
1434    File tempPersistencePath = new File(persistencePath + EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime());
1435    try (FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(tempPersistencePath, false)) {
1436      LOG.debug("Persist in new chunked persistence format.");
1437
1438      persistChunkedBackingMap(fos);
1439
1440      LOG.debug(
1441        "PersistToFile: after persisting backing map size: {}, fullycachedFiles size: {},"
1442          + " file name: {}",
1443        backingMap.size(), fullyCachedFiles.size(), tempPersistencePath.getName());
1444    } catch (IOException e) {
1445      LOG.error("Failed to persist bucket cache to file", e);
1446      throw e;
1447    } catch (Throwable e) {
1448      LOG.error("Failed during persist bucket cache to file: ", e);
1449      throw e;
1450    }
1451    LOG.debug("Thread {} finished persisting bucket cache to file, renaming",
1452      Thread.currentThread().getName());
1453    if (!tempPersistencePath.renameTo(new File(persistencePath))) {
1454      LOG.warn("Failed to commit cache persistent file. We might lose cached blocks if "
1455        + "RS crashes/restarts before we successfully checkpoint again.");
1456    }
1457  }
1458
1459  public boolean isCachePersistent() {
1460    return ioEngine.isPersistent() && persistencePath != null;
1461  }
1462
1463  @Override
1464  public Optional<Map<String, Long>> getRegionCachedInfo() {
1465    return Optional.of(Collections.unmodifiableMap(regionCachedSize));
1466  }
1467
1468  /**
1469   * @see #persistToFile()
1470   */
1471  private void retrieveFromFile(int[] bucketSizes) throws IOException {
1472    LOG.info("Started retrieving bucket cache from file");
1473    File persistenceFile = new File(persistencePath);
1474    if (!persistenceFile.exists()) {
1475      LOG.warn("Persistence file missing! "
1476        + "It's ok if it's first run after enabling persistent cache.");
1477      bucketAllocator = new BucketAllocator(cacheCapacity, bucketSizes, backingMap, realCacheSize);
1478      blockNumber.add(backingMap.size());
1479      backingMapValidated.set(true);
1480      return;
1481    }
1482    assert !isCacheEnabled();
1483
1484    try (FileInputStream in = new FileInputStream(persistenceFile)) {
1485      int pblen = ProtobufMagic.lengthOfPBMagic();
1486      byte[] pbuf = new byte[pblen];
1487      int read = in.read(pbuf);
1488      if (read != pblen) {
1489        throw new IOException("Incorrect number of bytes read while checking for protobuf magic "
1490          + "number. Requested=" + pblen + ", Received= " + read + ", File=" + persistencePath);
1491      }
1492      if (ProtobufMagic.isPBMagicPrefix(pbuf)) {
1493        LOG.info("Reading old format of persistence.");
1494        // The old non-chunked version of backing map persistence.
1495        parsePB(BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry.parseDelimitedFrom(in));
1496      } else if (Arrays.equals(pbuf, BucketProtoUtils.PB_MAGIC_V2)) {
1497        // The new persistence format of chunked persistence.
1498        LOG.info("Reading new chunked format of persistence.");
1499        retrieveChunkedBackingMap(in, bucketSizes);
1500      } else {
1501        // In 3.0 we have enough flexibility to dump the old cache data.
1502        // TODO: In 2.x line, this might need to be filled in to support reading the old format
1503        throw new IOException(
1504          "Persistence file does not start with protobuf magic number. " + persistencePath);
1505      }
1506      bucketAllocator = new BucketAllocator(cacheCapacity, bucketSizes, backingMap, realCacheSize);
1507      blockNumber.add(backingMap.size());
1508      LOG.info("Bucket cache retrieved from file successfully with size: {}", backingMap.size());
1509    }
1510  }
1511
1512  private void updateRegionSizeMapWhileRetrievingFromFile() {
1513    // Update the regionCachedSize with the region size while restarting the region server
1514    if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1515      LOG.debug("Updating region size map after retrieving cached file list");
1516      dumpPrefetchList();
1517    }
1518    regionCachedSize.clear();
1519    fullyCachedFiles.forEach((hFileName, hFileSize) -> {
1520      // Get the region name for each file
1521      String regionEncodedName = hFileSize.getFirst();
1522      long cachedFileSize = hFileSize.getSecond();
1523      regionCachedSize.merge(regionEncodedName, cachedFileSize,
1524        (oldpf, fileSize) -> oldpf + fileSize);
1525    });
1526  }
1527
1528  private void dumpPrefetchList() {
1529    for (Map.Entry<String, Pair<String, Long>> outerEntry : fullyCachedFiles.entrySet()) {
1530      LOG.debug("Cached File Entry:<{},<{},{}>>", outerEntry.getKey(),
1531        outerEntry.getValue().getFirst(), outerEntry.getValue().getSecond());
1532    }
1533  }
1534
1535  private void verifyCapacityAndClasses(long capacitySize, String ioclass, String mapclass)
1536    throws IOException {
1537    if (capacitySize != cacheCapacity) {
1538      throw new IOException("Mismatched cache capacity:" + StringUtils.byteDesc(capacitySize)
1539        + ", expected: " + StringUtils.byteDesc(cacheCapacity));
1540    }
1541    if (!ioEngine.getClass().getName().equals(ioclass)) {
1542      throw new IOException("Class name for IO engine mismatch: " + ioclass + ", expected:"
1543        + ioEngine.getClass().getName());
1544    }
1545    if (!backingMap.getClass().getName().equals(mapclass)) {
1546      throw new IOException("Class name for cache map mismatch: " + mapclass + ", expected:"
1547        + backingMap.getClass().getName());
1548    }
1549  }
1550
1551  private void verifyFileIntegrity(BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry proto) {
1552    try {
1553      if (proto.hasChecksum()) {
1554        ((PersistentIOEngine) ioEngine).verifyFileIntegrity(proto.getChecksum().toByteArray(),
1555          algorithm);
1556      }
1557      backingMapValidated.set(true);
1558    } catch (IOException e) {
1559      LOG.warn("Checksum for cache file failed. "
1560        + "We need to validate each cache key in the backing map. "
1561        + "This may take some time, so we'll do it in a background thread,");
1562
1563      Runnable cacheValidator = () -> {
1564        while (bucketAllocator == null) {
1565          try {
1566            Thread.sleep(50);
1567          } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
1568            throw new RuntimeException(ex);
1569          }
1570        }
1571        long startTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1572        int totalKeysOriginally = backingMap.size();
1573        for (Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> keyEntry : backingMap.entrySet()) {
1574          try {
1575            ((FileIOEngine) ioEngine).checkCacheTime(keyEntry.getValue());
1576          } catch (IOException e1) {
1577            LOG.debug("Check for key {} failed. Evicting.", keyEntry.getKey());
1578            evictBlock(keyEntry.getKey());
1579            fileNotFullyCached(keyEntry.getKey().getHfileName());
1580          }
1581        }
1582        backingMapValidated.set(true);
1583        LOG.info("Finished validating {} keys in the backing map. Recovered: {}. This took {}ms.",
1584          totalKeysOriginally, backingMap.size(),
1585          (EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() - startTime));
1586      };
1587      Thread t = new Thread(cacheValidator);
1588      t.setDaemon(true);
1589      t.start();
1590    }
1591  }
1592
1593  private void parseFirstChunk(BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry firstChunk) throws IOException {
1594    fullyCachedFiles.clear();
1595    Pair<ConcurrentHashMap<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry>, NavigableSet<BlockCacheKey>> pair =
1596      BucketProtoUtils.fromPB(firstChunk.getDeserializersMap(), firstChunk.getBackingMap(),
1597        this::createRecycler);
1598    backingMap.putAll(pair.getFirst());
1599    blocksByHFile.addAll(pair.getSecond());
1600    fullyCachedFiles.putAll(BucketProtoUtils.fromPB(firstChunk.getCachedFilesMap()));
1601  }
1602
1603  private void parseChunkPB(BucketCacheProtos.BackingMap chunk,
1604    java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer, java.lang.String> deserializer) throws IOException {
1605    Pair<ConcurrentHashMap<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry>, NavigableSet<BlockCacheKey>> pair2 =
1606      BucketProtoUtils.fromPB(deserializer, chunk, this::createRecycler);
1607    backingMap.putAll(pair2.getFirst());
1608    blocksByHFile.addAll(pair2.getSecond());
1609  }
1610
1611  private void parsePB(BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry proto) throws IOException {
1612    Pair<ConcurrentHashMap<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry>, NavigableSet<BlockCacheKey>> pair =
1613      BucketProtoUtils.fromPB(proto.getDeserializersMap(), proto.getBackingMap(),
1614        this::createRecycler);
1615    backingMap = pair.getFirst();
1616    blocksByHFile = pair.getSecond();
1617    fullyCachedFiles.clear();
1618    fullyCachedFiles.putAll(BucketProtoUtils.fromPB(proto.getCachedFilesMap()));
1619
1620    LOG.info("After retrieval Backing map size: {}, fullyCachedFiles size: {}", backingMap.size(),
1621      fullyCachedFiles.size());
1622
1623    verifyFileIntegrity(proto);
1624    updateRegionSizeMapWhileRetrievingFromFile();
1625    verifyCapacityAndClasses(proto.getCacheCapacity(), proto.getIoClass(), proto.getMapClass());
1626  }
1627
1628  private void persistChunkedBackingMap(FileOutputStream fos) throws IOException {
1629    long numChunks = backingMap.size() / persistenceChunkSize;
1630    if (backingMap.size() % persistenceChunkSize != 0) {
1631      numChunks += 1;
1632    }
1633
1634    LOG.debug(
1635      "persistToFile: before persisting backing map size: {}, "
1636        + "fullycachedFiles size: {}, chunkSize: {}, numberofChunks: {}",
1637      backingMap.size(), fullyCachedFiles.size(), persistenceChunkSize, numChunks);
1638
1639    BucketProtoUtils.serializeAsPB(this, fos, persistenceChunkSize, numChunks);
1640
1641    LOG.debug(
1642      "persistToFile: after persisting backing map size: {}, "
1643        + "fullycachedFiles size: {}, numChunksPersisteed: {}",
1644      backingMap.size(), fullyCachedFiles.size(), numChunks);
1645  }
1646
1647  private void retrieveChunkedBackingMap(FileInputStream in, int[] bucketSizes) throws IOException {
1648    byte[] bytes = new byte[Long.BYTES];
1649    int readSize = in.read(bytes);
1650    if (readSize != Long.BYTES) {
1651      throw new IOException("Invalid size of chunk-size read from persistence: " + readSize);
1652    }
1653    long batchSize = Bytes.toLong(bytes, 0);
1654
1655    readSize = in.read(bytes);
1656    if (readSize != Long.BYTES) {
1657      throw new IOException("Invalid size for number of chunks read from persistence: " + readSize);
1658    }
1659    long numChunks = Bytes.toLong(bytes, 0);
1660
1661    LOG.info("Number of chunks: {}, chunk size: {}", numChunks, batchSize);
1662
1663    // Read the first chunk that has all the details.
1664    BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry firstChunk =
1665      BucketCacheProtos.BucketCacheEntry.parseDelimitedFrom(in);
1666    parseFirstChunk(firstChunk);
1667
1668    // Subsequent chunks have the backingMap entries.
1669    for (int i = 1; i < numChunks; i++) {
1670      LOG.info("Reading chunk no: {}", i + 1);
1671      parseChunkPB(BucketCacheProtos.BackingMap.parseDelimitedFrom(in),
1672        firstChunk.getDeserializersMap());
1673      LOG.info("Retrieved chunk: {}", i + 1);
1674    }
1675    verifyFileIntegrity(firstChunk);
1676    verifyCapacityAndClasses(firstChunk.getCacheCapacity(), firstChunk.getIoClass(),
1677      firstChunk.getMapClass());
1678    updateRegionSizeMapWhileRetrievingFromFile();
1679  }
1680
1681  /**
1682   * Check whether we tolerate IO error this time. If the duration of IOEngine throwing errors
1683   * exceeds ioErrorsDurationTimeTolerated, we will disable the cache
1684   */
1685  private void checkIOErrorIsTolerated() {
1686    long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
1687    // Do a single read to a local variable to avoid timing issue - HBASE-24454
1688    long ioErrorStartTimeTmp = this.ioErrorStartTime;
1689    if (ioErrorStartTimeTmp > 0) {
1690      if (isCacheEnabled() && (now - ioErrorStartTimeTmp) > this.ioErrorsTolerationDuration) {
1691        LOG.error("IO errors duration time has exceeded " + ioErrorsTolerationDuration
1692          + "ms, disabling cache, please check your IOEngine");
1693        disableCache();
1694      }
1695    } else {
1696      this.ioErrorStartTime = now;
1697    }
1698  }
1699
1700  /**
1701   * Used to shut down the cache -or- turn it off in the case of something broken.
1702   */
1703  private void disableCache() {
1704    if (!isCacheEnabled()) {
1705      return;
1706    }
1707    LOG.info("Disabling cache");
1708    cacheState = CacheState.DISABLED;
1709    ioEngine.shutdown();
1710    this.scheduleThreadPool.shutdown();
1711    for (int i = 0; i < writerThreads.length; ++i)
1712      writerThreads[i].interrupt();
1713    this.ramCache.clear();
1714    if (!ioEngine.isPersistent() || persistencePath == null) {
1715      // If persistent ioengine and a path, we will serialize out the backingMap.
1716      this.backingMap.clear();
1717      this.blocksByHFile.clear();
1718      this.fullyCachedFiles.clear();
1719      this.regionCachedSize.clear();
1720    }
1721  }
1722
1723  private void join() throws InterruptedException {
1724    for (int i = 0; i < writerThreads.length; ++i)
1725      writerThreads[i].join();
1726  }
1727
1728  @Override
1729  public void shutdown() {
1730    disableCache();
1731    LOG.info("Shutdown bucket cache: IO persistent=" + ioEngine.isPersistent() + "; path to write="
1732      + persistencePath);
1733    if (ioEngine.isPersistent() && persistencePath != null) {
1734      try {
1735        join();
1736        if (cachePersister != null) {
1737          LOG.info("Shutting down cache persister thread.");
1738          cachePersister.shutdown();
1739          while (cachePersister.isAlive()) {
1740            Thread.sleep(10);
1741          }
1742        }
1743        persistToFile();
1744      } catch (IOException ex) {
1745        LOG.error("Unable to persist data on exit: " + ex.toString(), ex);
1746      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1747        LOG.warn("Failed to persist data on exit", e);
1748      }
1749    }
1750  }
1751
1752  /**
1753   * Needed mostly for UTs that might run in the same VM and create different BucketCache instances
1754   * on different UT methods.
1755   */
1756  @Override
1757  protected void finalize() {
1758    if (cachePersister != null && !cachePersister.isInterrupted()) {
1759      cachePersister.interrupt();
1760    }
1761  }
