1816
1817  /**
1818   * Evicts all blocks for a specific HFile.
1819   * <p>
1820   * This is used for evict-on-close to remove all blocks of a specific HFile.
1821   * @return the number of blocks evicted
1822   */
1823  @Override
1824  public int evictBlocksByHfileName(String hfileName) {
1825    return evictBlocksRangeByHfileName(hfileName, 0, Long.MAX_VALUE);
1826  }
1827
1828  @Override
1829  public int evictBlocksRangeByHfileName(String hfileName, long initOffset, long endOffset) {
1830    fileNotFullyCached(hfileName);
1831    Set<BlockCacheKey> keySet = getAllCacheKeysForFile(hfileName, initOffset, endOffset);
1832    LOG.debug("found {} blocks for file {}, starting offset: {}, end offset: {}", keySet.size(),
1833      hfileName, initOffset, endOffset);
1834    int numEvicted = 0;
1835    for (BlockCacheKey key : keySet) {
1836      if (evictBlock(key)) {
1837        ++numEvicted;
1838      }
1839    }
1840    return numEvicted;
1841  }
1842
1843  private Set<BlockCacheKey> getAllCacheKeysForFile(String hfileName, long init, long end) {
1844    return blocksByHFile.subSet(new BlockCacheKey(hfileName, init), true,
1845      new BlockCacheKey(hfileName, end), true);
1846  }
1847
1848  /**
1849   * Used to group bucket entries into priority buckets. There will be a BucketEntryGroup for each
1850   * priority (single, multi, memory). Once bucketed, the eviction algorithm takes the appropriate
1851   * number of elements out of each according to configuration parameters and their relative sizes.
1852   */
1853  private class BucketEntryGroup {
1854
1855    private CachedEntryQueue queue;
1856    private long totalSize = 0;
1857    private long bucketSize;
1858
1859    public BucketEntryGroup(long bytesToFree, long blockSize, long bucketSize) {
1860      this.bucketSize = bucketSize;
1861      queue = new CachedEntryQueue(bytesToFree, blockSize);
1862      totalSize = 0;
1863    }
1864
1865    public void add(Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> block) {
1866      totalSize += block.getValue().getLength();
1867      queue.add(block);
1868    }
1869
1870    public long free(long toFree) {
1871      Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> entry;
1872      long freedBytes = 0;
1873      // TODO avoid a cycling siutation. We find no block which is not in use and so no way to free
1874      // What to do then? Caching attempt fail? Need some changes in cacheBlock API?
1875      while ((entry = queue.pollLast()) != null) {
1876        BlockCacheKey blockCacheKey = entry.getKey();
1877        BucketEntry be = entry.getValue();
1878        if (evictBucketEntryIfNoRpcReferenced(blockCacheKey, be)) {
1879          freedBytes += be.getLength();
1880        }
1881        if (freedBytes >= toFree) {
1882          return freedBytes;
1883        }
1884      }
1885      return freedBytes;
1886    }
1887
1888    public long overflow() {
1889      return totalSize - bucketSize;
1890    }
1891
1892    public long totalSize() {
1893      return totalSize;
1894    }
1895  }
1896
1897  /**
1898   * Block Entry stored in the memory with key,data and so on
1899   */
1900  static class RAMQueueEntry {
1901    private final BlockCacheKey key;
1902    private final Cacheable data;
1903    private long accessCounter;
1904    private boolean inMemory;
1905    private boolean isCachePersistent;
1906
1907    RAMQueueEntry(BlockCacheKey bck, Cacheable data, long accessCounter, boolean inMemory,
1908      boolean isCachePersistent) {
1909      this.key = bck;
1910      this.data = data;
1911      this.accessCounter = accessCounter;
1912      this.inMemory = inMemory;
1913      this.isCachePersistent = isCachePersistent;
1914    }
1915
1916    public Cacheable getData() {
1917      return data;
1918    }
1919
1920    public BlockCacheKey getKey() {
1921      return key;
1922    }
1923
1924    public void access(long accessCounter) {
1925      this.accessCounter = accessCounter;
1926    }
1927
1928    private ByteBuffAllocator getByteBuffAllocator() {
1929      if (data instanceof HFileBlock) {
1930        return ((HFileBlock) data).getByteBuffAllocator();
1931      }
1932      return ByteBuffAllocator.HEAP;
1933    }
1934
1935    public BucketEntry writeToCache(final IOEngine ioEngine, final BucketAllocator alloc,
1936      final LongAdder realCacheSize, Function<BucketEntry, Recycler> createRecycler,
1937      ByteBuffer metaBuff) throws IOException {
1938      int len = data.getSerializedLength();
1939      // This cacheable thing can't be serialized
1940      if (len == 0) {
1941        return null;
1942      }
1943      if (isCachePersistent && data instanceof HFileBlock) {
1944        len += Long.BYTES; // we need to record the cache time for consistency check in case of
1945                           // recovery
1946      }
1947      long offset = alloc.allocateBlock(len);
1948      boolean succ = false;
1949      BucketEntry bucketEntry = null;
1950      try {
1951        int diskSizeWithHeader = (data instanceof HFileBlock)
1952          ? ((HFileBlock) data).getOnDiskSizeWithHeader()
1953          : data.getSerializedLength();
1954        bucketEntry = new BucketEntry(offset, len, diskSizeWithHeader, accessCounter, inMemory,
1955          createRecycler, getByteBuffAllocator());
1956        bucketEntry.setDeserializerReference(data.getDeserializer());
1957        if (data instanceof HFileBlock) {
1958          // If an instance of HFileBlock, save on some allocations.
1959          HFileBlock block = (HFileBlock) data;
1960          ByteBuff sliceBuf = block.getBufferReadOnly();
1961          block.getMetaData(metaBuff);
1962          // adds the cache time prior to the block and metadata part
1963          if (isCachePersistent) {
1964            ByteBuffer buffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(Long.BYTES);
1965            buffer.putLong(bucketEntry.getCachedTime());
1966            buffer.rewind();
1967            ioEngine.write(buffer, offset);
1968            ioEngine.write(sliceBuf, (offset + Long.BYTES));
1969          } else {
1970            ioEngine.write(sliceBuf, offset);
1971          }
1972          ioEngine.write(metaBuff, offset + len - metaBuff.limit());
1973        } else {
1974          // Only used for testing.
1975          ByteBuffer bb = ByteBuffer.allocate(len);
1976          data.serialize(bb, true);
1977          ioEngine.write(bb, offset);
1978        }
1979        succ = true;
1980      } finally {
1981        if (!succ) {
1982          alloc.freeBlock(offset, len);
1983        }
1984      }
1985      realCacheSize.add(len);
1986      return bucketEntry;
1987    }
1988  }
1989
1990  /**
1991   * Only used in test
1992   */
1993  void stopWriterThreads() throws InterruptedException {
1994    for (WriterThread writerThread : writerThreads) {
1995      writerThread.disableWriter();
1996      writerThread.interrupt();
1997      writerThread.join();
1998    }
1999  }
2000
2001  @Override
2002  public Iterator<CachedBlock> iterator() {
2003    // Don't bother with ramcache since stuff is in here only a little while.
2004    final Iterator<Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry>> i = this.backingMap.entrySet().iterator();
2005    return new Iterator<CachedBlock>() {
2006      private final long now = System.nanoTime();
2007
2008      @Override
2009      public boolean hasNext() {
2010        return i.hasNext();
2011      }
2012
2013      @Override
2014      public CachedBlock next() {
2015        final Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> e = i.next();
2016        return new CachedBlock() {
2017          @Override
2018          public String toString() {
2019            return BlockCacheUtil.toString(this, now);
2020          }
2021
2022          @Override
2023          public BlockPriority getBlockPriority() {
2024            return e.getValue().getPriority();
2025          }
2026
2027          @Override
2028          public BlockType getBlockType() {
2029            // Not held by BucketEntry. Could add it if wanted on BucketEntry creation.
2030            return null;
2031          }
2032
2033          @Override
2034          public long getOffset() {
2035            return e.getKey().getOffset();
2036          }
2037
2038          @Override
2039          public long getSize() {
2040            return e.getValue().getLength();
2041          }
2042
2043          @Override
2044          public long getCachedTime() {
2045            return e.getValue().getCachedTime();
2046          }
2047
2048          @Override
2049          public String getFilename() {
2050            return e.getKey().getHfileName();
2051          }
2052
2053          @Override
2054          public int compareTo(CachedBlock other) {
2055            int diff = this.getFilename().compareTo(other.getFilename());
2056            if (diff != 0) return diff;
2057
2058            diff = Long.compare(this.getOffset(), other.getOffset());
2059            if (diff != 0) return diff;
2060            if (other.getCachedTime() < 0 || this.getCachedTime() < 0) {
2061              throw new IllegalStateException(
2062                "" + this.getCachedTime() + ", " + other.getCachedTime());
2063            }
2064            return Long.compare(other.getCachedTime(), this.getCachedTime());
2065          }
2066
2067          @Override
2068          public int hashCode() {
2069            return e.getKey().hashCode();
2070          }
2071
2072          @Override
2073          public boolean equals(Object obj) {
2074            if (obj instanceof CachedBlock) {
2075              CachedBlock cb = (CachedBlock) obj;
2076              return compareTo(cb) == 0;
2077            } else {
2078              return false;
2079            }
2080          }
2081        };
2082      }
2083
2084      @Override
2085      public void remove() {
2086        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
2087      }
2088    };
2089  }
2090
2091  @Override
2092  public BlockCache[] getBlockCaches() {
2093    return null;
2094  }
2095
2096  public int getRpcRefCount(BlockCacheKey cacheKey) {
2097    BucketEntry bucketEntry = backingMap.get(cacheKey);
2098    if (bucketEntry != null) {
2099      return bucketEntry.refCnt() - (bucketEntry.markedAsEvicted.get() ? 0 : 1);
2100    }
2101    return 0;
2102  }

2131
2132  /**
2133   * Wrapped the delegate ConcurrentMap with maintaining its block's reference count.
2134   */
2135  static class RAMCache {
2136    /**
2137     * Defined the map as {@link ConcurrentHashMap} explicitly here, because in
2138     * {@link RAMCache#get(BlockCacheKey)} and
2139     * {@link RAMCache#putIfAbsent(BlockCacheKey, BucketCache.RAMQueueEntry)} , we need to guarantee
2140     * the atomicity of map#computeIfPresent(key, func) and map#putIfAbsent(key, func). Besides, the
2141     * func method can execute exactly once only when the key is present(or absent) and under the
2142     * lock context. Otherwise, the reference count of block will be messed up. Notice that the
2143     * {@link java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListMap} can not guarantee that.
2144     */
2145    final ConcurrentHashMap<BlockCacheKey, RAMQueueEntry> delegate = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
2146
2147    public boolean containsKey(BlockCacheKey key) {
2148      return delegate.containsKey(key);
2149    }
2150
2151    public RAMQueueEntry get(BlockCacheKey key) {
2152      return delegate.computeIfPresent(key, (k, re) -> {
2153        // It'll be referenced by RPC, so retain atomically here. if the get and retain is not
2154        // atomic, another thread may remove and release the block, when retaining in this thread we
2155        // may retain a block with refCnt=0 which is disallowed. (see HBASE-22422)
2156        re.getData().retain();
2157        return re;
2158      });
2159    }
2160
2161    /**
2162     * Return the previous associated value, or null if absent. It has the same meaning as
2163     * {@link ConcurrentMap#putIfAbsent(Object, Object)}
2164     */
2165    public RAMQueueEntry putIfAbsent(BlockCacheKey key, RAMQueueEntry entry) {
2166      AtomicBoolean absent = new AtomicBoolean(false);
2167      RAMQueueEntry re = delegate.computeIfAbsent(key, k -> {
2168        // The RAMCache reference to this entry, so reference count should be increment.
2169        entry.getData().retain();
2170        absent.set(true);
2171        return entry;
2172      });
2173      return absent.get() ? null : re;
2174    }
2175
2176    public boolean remove(BlockCacheKey key) {
2177      return remove(key, re -> {
2178      });
2179    }
2180
2181    /**
2182     * Defined an {@link Consumer} here, because once the removed entry release its reference count,
2183     * then it's ByteBuffers may be recycled and accessing it outside this method will be thrown an
2184     * exception. the consumer will access entry to remove before release its reference count.
2185     * Notice, don't change its reference count in the {@link Consumer}
2186     */
2187    public boolean remove(BlockCacheKey key, Consumer<RAMQueueEntry> action) {
2188      RAMQueueEntry previous = delegate.remove(key);
2189      action.accept(previous);
2190      if (previous != null) {
2191        previous.getData().release();
2192      }
2193      return previous != null;
2194    }
2195
2196    public boolean isEmpty() {
2197      return delegate.isEmpty();
2198    }
2199
2200    public void clear() {
2201      Iterator<Map.Entry<BlockCacheKey, RAMQueueEntry>> it = delegate.entrySet().iterator();
2202      while (it.hasNext()) {
2203        RAMQueueEntry re = it.next().getValue();
2204        it.remove();
2205        re.getData().release();
2206      }
2207    }
2208
2209    public boolean hasBlocksForFile(String fileName) {
2210      return delegate.keySet().stream().filter(key -> key.getHfileName().equals(fileName))
2211        .findFirst().isPresent();
2212    }
2213  }
2214
2215  public Map<BlockCacheKey, BucketEntry> getBackingMap() {
2216    return backingMap;
2217  }
2218
2219  public AtomicBoolean getBackingMapValidated() {
2220    return backingMapValidated;
2221  }
2222
2223  @Override
2224  public Optional<Map<String, Pair<String, Long>>> getFullyCachedFiles() {
2225    return Optional.of(fullyCachedFiles);
2226  }
2227
2228  public static Optional<BucketCache> getBucketCacheFromCacheConfig(CacheConfig cacheConf) {
2229    if (cacheConf.getBlockCache().isPresent()) {
2230      BlockCache bc = cacheConf.getBlockCache().get();
2231      if (bc instanceof CombinedBlockCache) {
2232        BlockCache l2 = ((CombinedBlockCache) bc).getSecondLevelCache();
2233        if (l2 instanceof BucketCache) {
2234          return Optional.of((BucketCache) l2);
2235        }
2236      } else if (bc instanceof BucketCache) {
2237        return Optional.of((BucketCache) bc);
2238      }
2239    }
2240    return Optional.empty();
2241  }
2242
2243  @Override
2244  public void notifyFileCachingCompleted(Path fileName, int totalBlockCount, int dataBlockCount,
2245    long size) {
2246    // block eviction may be happening in the background as prefetch runs,
2247    // so we need to count all blocks for this file in the backing map under
2248    // a read lock for the block offset
2249    final List<ReentrantReadWriteLock> locks = new ArrayList<>();
2250    LOG.debug("Notifying caching completed for file {}, with total blocks {}, and data blocks {}",
2251      fileName, totalBlockCount, dataBlockCount);
2252    try {
2253      final MutableInt count = new MutableInt();
2254      LOG.debug("iterating over {} entries in the backing map", backingMap.size());
2255      Set<BlockCacheKey> result = getAllCacheKeysForFile(fileName.getName(), 0, Long.MAX_VALUE);
2256      if (result.isEmpty() && StoreFileInfo.isReference(fileName)) {
2257        result = getAllCacheKeysForFile(
2258          StoreFileInfo.getReferredToRegionAndFile(fileName.getName()).getSecond(), 0,
2259          Long.MAX_VALUE);
2260      }
2261      result.stream().forEach(entry -> {
2262        LOG.debug("found block for file {} in the backing map. Acquiring read lock for offset {}",
2263          fileName.getName(), entry.getOffset());
2264        ReentrantReadWriteLock lock = offsetLock.getLock(entry.getOffset());
2265        lock.readLock().lock();
2266        locks.add(lock);
2267        if (backingMap.containsKey(entry) && entry.getBlockType() == BlockType.DATA) {
2268          count.increment();
2269        }
2270      });
2271      int metaCount = totalBlockCount - dataBlockCount;
2272      // BucketCache would only have data blocks
2273      if (dataBlockCount == count.getValue()) {
2274        LOG.debug("File {} has now been fully cached.", fileName);
2275        fileCacheCompleted(fileName, size);
2276      } else {
2277        LOG.debug(
2278          "Prefetch executor completed for {}, but only {} data blocks were cached. "
2279            + "Total data blocks for file: {}. "
2280            + "Checking for blocks pending cache in cache writer queue.",
2281          fileName, count.getValue(), dataBlockCount);
2282        if (ramCache.hasBlocksForFile(fileName.getName())) {
2283          for (ReentrantReadWriteLock lock : locks) {
2284            lock.readLock().unlock();
2285          }
2286          locks.clear();
2287          LOG.debug("There are still blocks pending caching for file {}. Will sleep 100ms "
2288            + "and try the verification again.", fileName);
2289          Thread.sleep(100);
2290          notifyFileCachingCompleted(fileName, totalBlockCount, dataBlockCount, size);
2291        } else if (
2292          (getAllCacheKeysForFile(fileName.getName(), 0, Long.MAX_VALUE).size() - metaCount)
2293              == dataBlockCount
2294        ) {
2295          LOG.debug("We counted {} data blocks, expected was {}, there was no more pending in "
2296            + "the cache write queue but we now found that total cached blocks for file {} "
2297            + "is equal to data block count.", count, dataBlockCount, fileName.getName());
2298          fileCacheCompleted(fileName, size);
2299        } else {
2300          LOG.info("We found only {} data blocks cached from a total of {} for file {}, "
2301            + "but no blocks pending caching. Maybe cache is full or evictions "
2302            + "happened concurrently to cache prefetch.", count, dataBlockCount, fileName);
2303        }
2304      }
2305    } catch (InterruptedException e) {
2306      throw new RuntimeException(e);
2307    } finally {
2308      for (ReentrantReadWriteLock lock : locks) {
2309        lock.readLock().unlock();
2310      }
2311    }
2312  }
2313
2314  @Override
2315  public Optional<Boolean> blockFitsIntoTheCache(HFileBlock block) {
2316    if (!isCacheInitialized("blockFitsIntoTheCache")) {
2317      return Optional.of(false);
2318    }
2319
2320    long currentUsed = bucketAllocator.getUsedSize();
2321    boolean result = (currentUsed + block.getOnDiskSizeWithHeader()) < acceptableSize();
2322    return Optional.of(result);
2323  }
2324
2325  @Override
2326  public Optional<Boolean> shouldCacheFile(String fileName) {
2327    // if we don't have the file in fullyCachedFiles, we should cache it
2328    return Optional.of(!fullyCachedFiles.containsKey(fileName));
2329  }
2330
2331  @Override
2332  public Optional<Boolean> isAlreadyCached(BlockCacheKey key) {
2333    boolean foundKey = backingMap.containsKey(key);
2334    // if there's no entry for the key itself, we need to check if this key is for a reference,
2335    // and if so, look for a block from the referenced file using this getBlockForReference method.
2336    return Optional.of(foundKey ? true : getBlockForReference(key) != null);
2337  }
2338
2339  @Override
2340  public Optional<Integer> getBlockSize(BlockCacheKey key) {
2341    BucketEntry entry = backingMap.get(key);
2342    if (entry == null) {
2343      // the key might be for a reference tha we had found the block from the referenced file in
2344      // the cache when we first tried to cache it.
2345      entry = getBlockForReference(key);
2346      return entry == null ? Optional.empty() : Optional.of(entry.getOnDiskSizeWithHeader());
2347    } else {
2348      return Optional.of(entry.getOnDiskSizeWithHeader());
2349    }
2350
2351  }
2352
2353  boolean isCacheInitialized(String api) {
2354    if (cacheState == CacheState.INITIALIZING) {
2355      LOG.warn("Bucket initialisation pending at {}", api);
2356      return false;
2357    }
2358    return true;
2359  }
2360
2361  @Override
2362  public boolean waitForCacheInitialization(long timeout) {
2363    try {
2364      while (cacheState == CacheState.INITIALIZING) {
2365        if (timeout <= 0) {
2366          break;
2367        }
2368        Thread.sleep(100);
2369        timeout -= 100;
2370      }
2371    } finally {
2372      return isCacheEnabled();
2373    }
2374  }
2375}
